snippet: Sales of Harvoni and an earlier hepatitis C drug, Sovaldi, far exceeded Wall Street expectations and made the company one of the top earners in pharmaceuticals.
abstract: Gilead Sciences reports surging first quarter profits, with earnings per share more than doubling to $2.76 from year-earlier period; reports that sales of its hepatitis C drugs reached $4.55 billion, largely reflecting popularity of its new drug, Harvoni.
lead_paragraph: Sales of Harvoni and an earlier hepatitis C drug, Sovaldi, far exceeded Wall Street expectations and made the company one of the top earners in pharmaceuticals.

headline.main: Gilead Hepatitis Drugs Brought In $4.55 Billion in First Quarter
headline.print_headline: Gilead Earnings Surge as Sales of Hepatitis Drugs Double, Exceeding Forecasts
